tools.name: RFDpoly
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based design of DNA, RNA, and proteins
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion-based machine learning model capable of de novo design of DNA, RNA, proteins, and mixed assemblies.

tools.name: RFdiffusion
tools.one_line_profile: State-of-the-art generative model for de novo protein structure design
tools.detailed_description: RFdiffusion is an open-source method for structure generation, with or without conditional information (a motif, target, etc). It can perform motif scaffolding, unconditional protein generation, and symmetric oligomer design. It represents a significant advance in protein design capabilities using diffusion models.

tools.name: RFdiffusion2
tools.one_line_profile: Updated inference code for the next generation of RFdiffusion
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the inference code for RFdiffusion2, the successor to the original RFdiffusion model. It provides improved capabilities for de novo protein design and structure generation tasks.

tools.name: protein_generator
tools.one_line_profile: Joint sequence and structure generation using RoseTTAFold diffusion
tools.detailed_description: A tool for simultaneous generation of protein sequences and structures. It leverages the RoseTTAFold architecture within a sequence space diffusion framework to explore novel protein designs.

tools.name: gcWGAN
tools.one_line_profile: Guided Conditional Wasserstein GAN for de novo protein design
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Guided Conditional Wasserstein Generative Adversarial Network (gcWGAN) specifically designed for generating novel protein backbone structures with specific properties.

tools.name: DiffAffinity
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion model for predicting mutational effects on protein-protein binding
tools.detailed_description: A probabilistic model using side-chain diffusion to predict how mutations affect protein-protein binding affinity. It leverages geometric deep learning to model the structural context of mutations.

tools.name: cath-funsite-predictor
tools.one_line_profile: Predictor for protein functional sites based on CATH data
tools.detailed_description: Code base associated with CATH for predicting and generating protein functional sites. It utilizes structural and evolutionary information to identify key functional regions in proteins.

tools.name: BASS
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for bistable auxetic surface structure patterns
tools.detailed_description: Bistable Auxetic Surface Structures (BASS) is an application for generating fabrication patterns for morphing structures. It is used in materials science and mechanical engineering for designing programmable materials.

tools.name: Proteus
tools.one_line_profile: Protein structure generation model for enhanced designability
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ICML 2024 paper 'Proteus'. It explores protein structure generation techniques to improve the designability and efficiency of de novo protein design tasks.

tools.name: Libra
tools.one_line_profile: Temporally-aware MLLM for biomedical radiology report generation
tools.detailed_description: A multimodal large language model (MLLM) toolkit designed for biomedical radiology analysis. It supports real-time validation and report generation, focusing on temporal awareness in medical imaging data.

tools.name: IPDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Binding-aware 3D molecule diffusion model with interaction priors
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ICLR 2024 paper. IPDiff incorporates protein-ligand interaction priors into a 3D molecule diffusion model to generate molecules with better binding characteristics.

tools.name: IRDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Retrieval-augmented diffusion model for protein-specific molecule generation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ICML 2024 paper. IRDiff uses interaction-based retrieval augmentation to guide diffusion models in generating 3D molecules tailored to specific protein targets.

tools.name: seqdesign-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Autoregressive generative models for protein design and variant prediction
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of autoregressive models for generating protein sequences and predicting the effects of variants. Useful for sequence-based protein engineering.

tools.name: ProtT3
tools.one_line_profile: Protein-to-Text generation model for protein understanding
tools.detailed_description: Source code for the ACL 2024 paper 'ProtT3'. It focuses on generating textual descriptions from protein sequences/structures to facilitate text-based protein understanding and annotation.

tools.name: ProtFill
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for inpainting protein sequence and structure
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by Adaptyv Bio for filling in (inpainting) missing regions of protein sequences and structures, useful for protein engineering and design tasks.

tools.name: LD-FPG
tools.one_line_profile: Latent diffusion on graph embeddings for full-atom protein conformation generation
tools.detailed_description: Official PyTorch implementation for the NeurIPS 2025 paper. It uses latent diffusion models on graph embeddings to generate full-atom protein conformations.

tools.name: ProDMM
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal sequence modeling for Protein-DNA interdependency
tools.detailed_description: A unified multimodal sequence modeling framework for understanding and generating protein-DNA interactions. It aims to unveil the interdependency between protein and DNA sequences.

tools.name: FADiff
tools.one_line_profile: Floating Anchor Diffusion Model for multi-motif scaffolding
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ICML 2024 paper. FADiff is a diffusion model designed for scaffolding multiple motifs in protein design, allowing for flexible anchor placement.

tools.name: VFN
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric Vector Field Networks for de novo protein design
tools.detailed_description: Official repository for the ICLR 2024 paper. VFN uses geometric vector field networks to guide the de novo design of protein structures.

tools.name: Computational-design-of-protein-nanomachines
tools.one_line_profile: Code for designing nanoscale rotational mechanics in proteins
tools.detailed_description: Software and code used for the computational design of protein nanomachines, specifically focusing on nanoscale rotational mechanics in de novo protein assemblies.

tools.name: proteinzen
tools.one_line_profile: All-atom generative protein design using SE(3) flow matching
tools.detailed_description: A tool for all-atom protein generation that utilizes SE(3) flow matching techniques. It aims to generate physically plausible protein structures.

tools.name: plaid
tools.one_line_profile: Latent diffusion for all-atom protein generation with taxonomic prompts
tools.detailed_description: PLAID (Protein Latent All-Atom Diffusion) is a generative model for designing proteins. It supports compositional function and taxonomic prompts to guide the generation process.

tools.name: Genie
tools.one_line_profile: De novo protein design model using equivariant diffusion on oriented residue clouds
tools.detailed_description: Genie is a generative model for de novo protein design that employs equivariant diffusion processes on oriented residue clouds. It is designed to generate novel protein backbones by learning the distribution of protein structures in a SE(3)-equivariant manner.

tools.name: Genie 2
tools.one_line_profile: Protein structure diffusion model for unconditional generation and motif scaffolding
tools.detailed_description: Genie 2 is an advanced protein structure diffusion model capable of both unconditional protein generation and motif scaffolding. It builds upon the original Genie architecture to provide enhanced capabilities for designing proteins with specific structural motifs.

tools.name: In-silico Design Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for evaluating protein structure diffusion models via folding and metrics
tools.detailed_description: An in-silico design pipeline specifically developed for evaluating the quality and viability of protein structures generated by diffusion models. It likely integrates folding simulations (like AlphaFold/ESMFold) and structural metric calculations to assess design success.

tools.name: SCISOR
tools.one_line_profile: Method for shrinking proteins using diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: SCISOR implements a diffusion-based approach to 'shrink' proteins, likely referring to generating smaller protein variants or scaffolds while maintaining structural properties. It serves as a specific solver for protein engineering tasks.

tools.name: ChemSpaceAL
tools.one_line_profile: Active learning methodology for protein-specific molecular generation
tools.detailed_description: ChemSpaceAL is an efficient active learning framework designed for generating molecules specifically targeted to proteins. It combines molecular generation with active learning strategies to explore chemical space effectively for drug discovery.

tools.name: SPROF-GO
tools.one_line_profile: Protein function prediction using pretrained language models and label diffusion
tools.detailed_description: SPROF-GO is a tool for fast and accurate protein function prediction (Gene Ontology terms) from sequence data. It leverages pretrained protein language models and homology-based label diffusion techniques to annotate protein functions.

tools.name: AlphaFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Flow matching model for generating protein structural ensembles
tools.detailed_description: AlphaFlow combines AlphaFold with flow matching techniques to generate ensembles of protein structures. This approach allows for modeling the conformational diversity and dynamics of proteins beyond static structure prediction.

tools.name: MotifBench
tools.one_line_profile: Standardized benchmark for protein motif-scaffolding problems
tools.detailed_description: MotifBench provides a standardized set of benchmark tasks and datasets for evaluating protein design algorithms, specifically focusing on the motif-scaffolding problem. It serves as a reference for comparing different generative models.

tools.name: ProtDiff_SMCDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion probabilistic modeling of protein backbones for motif scaffolding
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the implementation of SMCDiff (Sequential Monte Carlo Diffusion), a method for diffusion probabilistic modeling of protein backbones in 3D, specifically applied to the motif-scaffolding problem.

tools.name: ConfDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Protein conformation generation via force-guided SE(3) diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: ConfDiff is a generative model for protein conformation generation that utilizes force-guided SE(3) diffusion models. It aims to generate biologically plausible protein conformations by incorporating physical constraints or guidance.

tools.name: DPLM
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion Protein Language Models for protein design
tools.detailed_description: DPLM (Diffusion Protein Language Models) is a family of models that combine diffusion processes with protein language modeling. It is designed for protein sequence and structure generation tasks.

tools.name: GCA-GPD
tools.one_line_profile: Global-context aware generative protein design model
tools.detailed_description: This tool implements a global-context aware generative model for protein design. It focuses on capturing global structural context to improve the quality and coherence of generated protein sequences and structures.

tools.name: DEPACT & PACMatch
tools.one_line_profile: Programs for de novo ligand-binding pocket design in protein scaffolds
tools.detailed_description: DEPACT and PACMatch are computational tools designed for the de novo design of ligand-binding pockets within protein scaffolds. They enable the engineering of proteins with specific binding capabilities for small molecules.

tools.name: Chromatix
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable wave optics simulation library using JAX
tools.detailed_description: Chromatix is a library for differentiable wave optics simulations, built on JAX. It allows for the modeling and optimization of optical systems, enabling tasks like holographic reconstruction and optical design via gradient-based methods.

tools.name: bcpaff
tools.one_line_profile: Protein-ligand binding affinity prediction using electron density geometric deep learning
tools.detailed_description: bcpaff explores protein-ligand binding affinity prediction by utilizing electron density-based geometric deep learning. It serves as a predictive model for assessing the strength of interactions between proteins and potential drug molecules.

tools.name: Diffuse2Direct
tools.one_line_profile: Orientation of protein-protein interaction networks using diffusion techniques
tools.detailed_description: Diffuse2Direct applies network diffusion techniques to orient protein-protein interaction (PPI) networks. It helps in inferring directionality or signal flow within biological interaction networks.

tools.name: SeqDesign
tools.one_line_profile: Protein design and variant prediction using autoregressive generative models
tools.detailed_description: SeqDesign utilizes autoregressive generative models for protein design and variant prediction. It is capable of generating novel protein sequences and predicting the effects of mutations, aiding in protein engineering.

tools.name: PharmacoForge
tools.one_line_profile: Generates pharmacophores conditioned on a protein pocket using diffusion
tools.detailed_description: PharmacoForge is a tool that uses a diffusion model to generate pharmacophores conditioned on the structure of a protein binding pocket. It aids in structure-based drug design by identifying key interaction features.

tools.name: ProtHint
tools.one_line_profile: Protein hint generation pipeline for gene finding in eukaryotic genomes
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline that predicts and scores protein hints (introns, start/stop codons) to improve gene prediction accuracy in eukaryotic genomes, often used in conjunction with GeneMark-EP.

tools.name: DiffDock
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based generative model for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art diffusion generative model that predicts the 3D binding structure of small molecule ligands to protein targets, treating docking as a generative modeling problem over the manifold of ligand poses.

tools.name: DisCo-Diff
tools.one_line_profile: Enhanced diffusion model with discrete latents for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of DisCo-Diff, which improves upon continuous diffusion models by incorporating discrete latents to better model the multimodal distribution of molecular docking poses.

tools.name: Chroma
tools.one_line_profile: Generative model for programmable protein design
tools.detailed_description: A generative model capable of designing novel protein structures and sequences with programmable constraints, enabling the creation of proteins with specific geometric or functional properties.

tools.name: OMTRA
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-task generative model for structure-based drug design
tools.detailed_description: A generative model designed for structure-based drug design that leverages multi-task learning to generate molecules fitting specific protein pockets.

tools.name: bbflow
tools.one_line_profile: Flow matching model for protein backbone ensemble generation
tools.detailed_description: A flow matching-based generative model specifically designed to generate conformational ensembles of protein backbones, capturing structural diversity.

tools.name: chromap
tools.one_line_profile: Fast alignment and preprocessing of chromatin profiles
tools.detailed_description: An ultrafast alignment tool specifically optimized for chromatin profiling data (e.g., ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq), handling mapping and preprocessing efficiently.

tools.name: PIDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed diffusion model for protein pocket-specific generation
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion model that incorporates physical constraints to generate 3D molecules specifically designed to fit into protein binding pockets.

tools.name: GAFL
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric Algebra Flow Matching for protein backbone generation
tools.detailed_description: A generative model using Geometric Algebra Flow Matching to generate protein backbones, leveraging geometric algebra for better representation of 3D structures.

tools.name: Chemeleon
tools.one_line_profile: Text-guided diffusion model for crystal structure generation
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion-based model that generates crystal structures conditioned on text descriptions, enabling language-guided materials design.

tools.name: ProGen2-finetuning
tools.one_line_profile: Finetuning tools for ProGen2 protein language model
tools.detailed_description: Codebase for fine-tuning the ProGen2 protein language model on specific protein families to generate novel sequences with desired properties.

tools.name: sparrow
tools.one_line_profile: Sequence parameter library for intrinsically disordered proteins
tools.detailed_description: A library for calculating sequence-based parameters and properties relevant to intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs), such as charge decoration and hydrophobicity patterns.

tools.name: ProToken
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable protein engineering using diffusion transformers
tools.detailed_description: A framework for protein engineering that uses a diffusion transformer over 'ProTokens' (protein tokens) to enable differentiable design and generation.

tools.name: BindingSitesFromFragments
tools.one_line_profile: De novo design of small molecule binding sites
tools.detailed_description: A computational tool for the de novo design of small molecule binding sites into proteins, utilizing fragment-based approaches.

tools.name: se3_diffusion
tools.one_line_profile: SE(3) diffusion model for protein backbone generation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of an SE(3) equivariant diffusion model for generating protein backbone structures, a foundational method in geometric deep learning for proteins.

tools.name: Graph-Based Protein Design
tools.one_line_profile: Generative models for graph-based protein design
tools.detailed_description: Code for the NeurIPS 2019 paper 'Generative Models for Graph-Based Protein Design', providing graph neural network models for designing protein sequences given a structure.

tools.name: AutoProteinDesign
tools.one_line_profile: Automated workflow for protein design using RFDiffusion and ProteinMPNN
tools.detailed_description: A script that automates the protein design pipeline by integrating RFDiffusion for backbone generation, ProteinMPNN for sequence design, and AlphaFold for validation.

tools.name: ambient-proteins
tools.one_line_profile: Ambient diffusion for protein structure generation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Ambient Protein Diffusion', a method for learning to generate protein structures from noisy or incomplete data.

tools.name: DrugHIVE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep hierarchical generative model for structure-based drug design
tools.detailed_description: A hierarchical generative model for designing drug-like molecules based on protein pocket structures, facilitating structure-based drug discovery.

tools.name: SGPO
tools.one_line_profile: Steering discrete diffusion models for protein fitness optimization
tools.detailed_description: A method for steering discrete diffusion models using labeled data to optimize protein sequences for specific fitness traits.

tools.name: metakappa
tools.one_line_profile: Meta-language for Kappa protein interaction rule generation
tools.detailed_description: A meta-language tool that simplifies the creation of Kappa models for protein interactions by allowing concise representation of protein hierarchies and rules.

tools.name: DiffDock-PP
tools.one_line_profile: Rigid protein-protein docking with diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: An extension of DiffDock specifically tailored for rigid protein-protein docking, utilizing diffusion models to predict complex structures.

tools.name: DiffModeler
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion model-based protein complex structure modeling
tools.detailed_description: A tool for modeling protein complex structures using diffusion models, aiming to predict the assembly of multiple protein subunits.

tools.name: ProteinDiffusionGenerator
tools.one_line_profile: Generative method for designing novel proteins using diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: A generative framework developed by the MIT Laboratory for Atomistic and Molecular Mechanics that utilizes diffusion models to design novel protein structures.

tools.name: ProtDesign2
tools.one_line_profile: Protein design workflow integrating RFdiffusion and ProteinMPNN
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for protein design that combines RFdiffusion for backbone generation and ProteinMPNN/LigandMPNN for sequence design.

tools.name: context-guided-diffusion
tools.one_line_profile: Context-Guided Diffusion for molecular and protein design
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Context-Guided Diffusion, a method for out-of-distribution molecular and protein design, enabling targeted generation of chemical and biological structures.

tools.name: chroma-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Chroma for protein generation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source implementation of Chroma, a generative model for proteins using Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPM) and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs).

tools.name: ddpm-ipa-protein-generation
tools.one_line_profile: DDPM with Invariant Point Attention for protein generation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model (DDPM) combined with Invariant Point Attention (IPA) for equivariant protein structure and sequence generation.

tools.name: ddpm-proteins
tools.one_line_profile: DDPM for conditional generation of protein distograms
tools.detailed_description: A Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model (DDPM) specifically tailored for the conditional generation of protein distance maps (distograms), useful for structure prediction tasks.

tools.name: equiformer-diffusion
tools.one_line_profile: Equiformer-based diffusion model for protein design
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a denoising diffusion model for protein design utilizing Equiformer (SE(3)/E(3) equivariant attention) architecture for improved geometric modeling.

tools.name: progen-jax
tools.one_line_profile: Jax implementation of ProGen for protein language modeling
tools.detailed_description: An implementation and replication of ProGen (Language Modeling for Protein Generation) using Jax, enabling protein sequence generation and analysis.

tools.name: esmdiff
tools.one_line_profile: Structure Language Models for Protein Conformation Generation
tools.detailed_description: Codebase for 'Structure Language Models for Protein Conformation Generation', providing tools for generating protein conformations using language model techniques.

tools.name: 3D-Generative-SBDD
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Generative Model for Structure-Based Drug Design
tools.detailed_description: A 3D generative model designed for Structure-Based Drug Design (SBDD), capable of generating ligand structures within protein binding pockets.

tools.name: diffab
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based generative model for antibody design
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion-based generative model for antigen-specific antibody design and optimization, focusing on the generation of antibody structures and sequences.

tools.name: AlignInversePro
tools.one_line_profile: Inference-Time Alignment in Protein Diffusion Models
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inference-time alignment in protein diffusion models, allowing for better control and adherence to constraints during protein structure generation.

tools.name: ProDifEvo-Refinement
tools.one_line_profile: Evolutionary Algorithm with Diffusion Models for Protein Design
tools.detailed_description: Combines evolutionary algorithms with diffusion models to refine and optimize protein designs.

tools.name: SVDD
tools.one_line_profile: Derivative-Free Guidance in Diffusion Models for Bio-sequences
tools.detailed_description: Implements Soft Value-Based Decoding (SVDD) for derivative-free guidance in diffusion models, applicable to controlled generation of DNA, RNA, and proteins.

tools.name: GelGenie
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of gel electrophoresis images using machine learning
tools.detailed_description: An open-source package for the segmentation and analysis of gel electrophoresis images, providing both a Python framework and a QuPath GUI extension.

tools.name: TopoDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Global-geometry-aware diffusion for protein backbone generation
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion-based model for protein backbone generation that incorporates global geometry-aware latent encoding to improve structure quality.

tools.name: EvoDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete diffusion models for protein sequence generation
tools.detailed_description: A framework for generating protein sequences and evolutionary alignments using discrete diffusion models, enabling the exploration of protein sequence space.

tools.name: FoldingDiff
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion models for protein structure generation
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion model based approach for generating protein backbone structures, utilizing angles and attention mechanisms.

tools.name: Protein Frame Flow
tools.one_line_profile: Fast protein backbone generation with SE(3) flow matching
tools.detailed_description: A method for fast and efficient generation of protein backbones using SE(3) flow matching techniques.

tools.name: salad
tools.one_line_profile: Protein structure generation with sparse all-atom denoising
tools.detailed_description: A model for generating protein structures using sparse all-atom denoising techniques, facilitating high-resolution structure synthesis.

tools.name: nf-core/proteinfamilies
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for generation and updating of protein families
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for the generation and updating of protein families, facilitating large-scale comparative genomics and protein classification.

tools.name: NOS
tools.one_line_profile: Protein Design with Guided Discrete Diffusion
tools.detailed_description: A tool for protein design utilizing guided discrete diffusion models to generate sequences with desired properties.

tools.name: EquiDock
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning for fast rigid 3D protein-protein docking
tools.detailed_description: A geometric deep learning model for fast and accurate rigid 3D protein-protein docking, predicting the complex structure from unbound protein structures.

tools.name: Path-Planning (P2)
tools.one_line_profile: Masked diffusion model sampling method for sequence generation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing P2 (Path Planning), a sampling method for masked diffusion models applied to sequence generation tasks, including protein sequence generation.

tools.name: protein-sequence-diffusion-model
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion model specifically designed for protein sequence generation
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion-based generative model implementation focused on generating protein sequences, serving as a tool for exploring sequence space in protein engineering.

tools.name: DiffDock-Pocket
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based pocket-level molecular docking tool
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of DiffDock-Pocket that applies diffusion models to pocket-level docking with side chain flexibility, facilitating structure-based drug design.

tools.name: RamaNet
tools.one_line_profile: De novo protein design using machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A tool for de novo protein design that leverages machine learning and PyRosetta to generate novel protein structures, focusing on Ramachandran plot constraints.

tools.name: GGNN_Meets_PLM
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of protein language models with geometric deep learning
tools.detailed_description: A framework integrating pre-trained protein language models into geometric deep learning networks to enhance protein representation learning and structure-property prediction.

tools.name: DiffDock (Colab)
tools.one_line_profile: Colab implementation of DiffDock for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: A ready-to-use Colab notebook implementation of DiffDock, facilitating the application of diffusion models for molecular docking tasks without local setup.

tools.name: MolScribe
tools.one_line_profile: Image-to-graph generation for molecular structure recognition
tools.detailed_description: A robust tool for recognizing molecular structures from images and converting them into graph representations, useful for digitizing chemical literature and data extraction.

tools.name: DeepPBS
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning for protein-DNA binding specificity
tools.detailed_description: A geometric deep learning tool designed to predict protein-DNA binding specificity, aiding in the understanding of regulatory mechanisms and structural biology.

tools.name: GENIE3
tools.one_line_profile: Inference of gene regulatory networks from expression data
tools.detailed_description: A classic machine learning-based tool for inferring gene regulatory networks from gene expression data, widely used in systems biology.

tools.name: Evolla (ProteinChat)
tools.one_line_profile: Protein-language generative model for decoding molecular language
tools.detailed_description: A frontier protein-language generative model (ProteinChat) designed to decode and generate the molecular language of proteins, facilitating protein design and analysis.

tools.name: FLAG
tools.one_line_profile: Molecule Generation for Target Protein Binding with Structural Motifs
tools.detailed_description: A 3D generative model for structure-based drug design that generates molecules binding to specific protein targets while incorporating structural motifs. Implementation of the ICLR 2023 paper.

tools.name: PocketFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized Protein Pocket Generation with Prior-Informed Flow Matching
tools.detailed_description: A generative model for creating protein pockets using prior-informed flow matching, facilitating the design of novel binding sites. Implementation of the NeurIPS 2024 paper.

tools.name: GeoBind
tools.one_line_profile: Segmentation of nucleic acid binding interface on protein surface
tools.detailed_description: A geometric deep learning tool for segmenting and predicting nucleic acid binding interfaces on protein surfaces, aiding in the analysis of protein-DNA/RNA interactions.
